private_information: Can manipulate vowel blocks only: A, E, I
Can hold at most one block at a time
V.goal: Help achieve the final stacking arrangement by moving vowel blocks (A, E, I) following the global constraints.

private_information: Can manipulate consonant blocks only: B, C, D, F, G
Can hold at most one block at a time
C.goal: Help achieve the final stacking arrangement by moving consonant blocks (B, C, D, F, G) following the global constraints.

orchestrator.goal: Generate a PDDL domain and problem describing the two-agent block stacking task that enforces all constraints and enables finding a valid plan.

init.access_rule: Only top block of a stack is movable.
init.mutual_placement_constraint: While one agent is holding a block, the other agent cannot place a block on top of that held block.

goal.description: Arrange blocks into two stacks with bases F and A and specified chains.

constraints.A_on_table: A is on the table as base of a stack
constraints.F_on_table: F is on the table as base of a stack

public_information: There are eight blocks: A, B, C, D, E, F, G, I.
Vowel blocks: A, E, I. Consonant blocks: B, C, D, F, G.
Only the top block of a stack is accessible for movement.
No more than 3 stacks may exist on the table at any time.
Each agent may hold at most one block.
An agent may only move blocks from its allowed set (vowel vs consonant).
You may place a held block on top of the top block of any existing stack or on the table (creating a new stack) subject to the max stacks constraint.
You may not place a block on top of a block currently held by the other agent.

orchestrator.system_prompt: You are an expert with multi-agent PDDL problems. You will be provided information about the environment and the capabilities and knowledge of the agents which interact in the environment. You always provide a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file that describes the planning problem. Enclose the pddl domain between <domain></domain> tags, and the pddl problem between <problem></problem> tags. Keep the actions for different agents distinct, so that there is no confusion as to which agent performs which action. Ensure constraints: top-only moves, vowel/consonant move permissions, max 3 stacks, each agent holds at most one block, and placement cannot target a block held by the other agent. Model stacks, holding state, and number-of-stacks invariant explicitly.
orchestrator.prompt:
Your name is orchestrator.
Initial information about the environment: {environment->init}.
Goal for the environment: {environment->goal}.
The public information is: {environment->public_information}.
The V agent's constraints are: {agents->agent_details->V->private_information}.
The C agent's constraints are: {agents->agent_details->C->private_information}.
Think step by step and provide a PDDL domain and problem that encapsulate the integrated model, respecting the constraints of each agent. Do not make assumptions beyond the given information. There is no need for anything else beyond producing the pddl files.
